title: Bahram II
summary: Bahram II (also spelled Wahram II or  Warahran II; Middle Persian: ğ­¥ğ­«ğ­§ğ­«ğ­ ğ­­â€) was the fifth Sasanian King of Kings (shahanshah) of Iran, from 274 to 293. He was the son and successor of Bahram I (r.Â 271â€“274). Bahram II, while still in his teens, ascended the throne with the aid of the powerful Zoroastrian priest Kartir, just like his father had done.
